page.home.title: [V] _üContent Credentials
page.verify.title: [W] _üVerify
page.apply.title: [T] _üApply
sidebar.apply.title: [r] _üApply Content Credentials to your existing files
sidebar.apply.description: [i] _üAttribution-based Content Credentials capture your content as it appears today and can help you get more credit for your work.
sidebar.apply.credit.description: [g] _üYou can include your name as it appears on your Adobe account, contact info, and a statement against using your content to train AI models.
sidebar.apply.credit.name: [h] _üInclude my name
sidebar.apply.credit.AI: [e] _üDo not use my content to train AI models
sidebar.apply.process.description: [p] _üYou can include the ingredient used to produce your content.
sidebar.apply.advanced.description: [a] _üPublishing to the public Content Credentials cloud keeps file sizes smaller and makes Content Credentials recoverable.
sidebar.apply.advanced.both: [Z] _üAttach to files an publish to Content Credentials cloud
sidebar.apply.legal:
[j] _üThis feature runs locally on your device from the browser. Your selected files are not externally uploaded, saved, viewable, or accessible.

When using Content Credentials cloud as a storage option, if you close this window after applying Content Credentials and before saving your files, your Content Credentials will not appear with your content when published or inspected in Verify. However, they will be recoverable when searching for possible matches in Verify.
footer.rights: [E] _üDo not sell or share my personal information
